intro: Pleiogyne nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleiogyne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is often found in wet or swampy areas, thriving in moist, tropical environments.
